message.content:
cs.MM, cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a cooperative video streaming system that optimizes quality decisions and fetching policies of SVC layers of video chunks subject to available bandwidth, chunk deadlines, and cooperation willingness of different users. This involves optimization algorithms and QoE metrics, which are typically studied in the Multimedia (cs.MM) and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper deals with bandwidth prediction and optimization, which are also relevant to the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses fairness and performance of the proposed algorithm, which are topics of interest in the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
